definition: to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Interests are the governing factor in maintaining the relation between the Party and the mass.
sentences.chinese: 利益是维系党群关系的决定性因素。

sentences.english: It has scored a knockout win over token ring.
sentences.chinese: 它已取得了决定性的胜利，打倒了令牌环网。

sentences.english: To date, no researcher has claimed that genes can determine sexual orientation.
sentences.chinese: 直至今日，没有研究人士声称基因可以决定性取向。

sentences.english: The higher educational funds assignment pattern has great influence on the students enrollment policy.
sentences.chinese: 高等教育经费分配模式对招生政策具有决定性的影响。

sentences.english: The decisive attack took off fromthe foremost position.
sentences.chinese: 决定性进攻是从最前沿阵地开始的。

sentences.english: But the most important agent in the secularizing process was science.
sentences.chinese: 但是在脱离教会的过程中做出决定性一击的是科学。

sentences.english: The death of Mr. bin Laden is a defining moment in the American-led war on terrorism.
sentences.chinese: 本拉登之死是美国领导的反恐战争的决定性的时刻。

sentences.english: The puzzling part is a critical stage of all invention and inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 这个冥思苦想的部分是所有发明和灵感的决定性阶段。

sentences.english: Transcription errors are of decisive importance in stemmatics.
sentences.chinese: 抄写错误在校定学中具有决定性的重要性。

sentences.english: Q. Did you expect it to be as decisive as this with the Red Bulls picking up just one point?
sentences.chinese: 你是否认为这是与红牛争斗中的一场决定性的胜利？

sentences.english: The symmetry of electrode is crucial for the extinction ration.
sentences.chinese: 电极位置的对称性对器件串音度起决定性的影响。

sentences.english: He had performed brilliantly and capped it off with the clinching goal.
sentences.chinese: 他在决赛中表现出色，并攻入决定性的进球。

sentences.english: Cloud has a dominant influence on radiation.
sentences.chinese: 云对辐射有决定性的作用。

sentences.english: For that we have to rely on indirect and inconclusive evidence.
sentences.chinese: 因而，我们必须依靠间接和非决定性的证据。

sentences.english: When the decisive goal is waived offside by another incorrect lines-blind.
sentences.chinese: 当一个决定性的进球被另一个瞎子吹成了越位。

sentences.english: We have to lift our heads and the away game at France is decisive.
sentences.chinese: 我们要昂起头，毕竟到法国后比赛才是决定性的。

definition: to act on/to affect/action/function/activity/impact/result/effect/purpose/intent/to play a role/corresponds to English -ity, -ism, -ization/CL:個|个[ge4]
clearly and easy to see (idiom); obviously/clearly/it goes without saying
a tiny bit/very little/next to nothing (idiom)
to have an effect/to play a role/to be operative/to work/to function
victory or defeat/the outcome of a battle
to display/to exhibit/to bring out implicit or innate qualities/to express (a thought or moral)/to develop (an idea)/to elaborate (on a theme)
